thread.title: Santi Cazorla is next Arsenal man out longer than expected | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Santi Cazorla is next Arsenal man out longer than expected | Daily Mail Online

author: Jack Bezants For Mailonline
title: Santi Cazorla is next Arsenal man out longer than expected | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share But his absence for the remainder of the season is a huge blow for the Gunners, with the battle to finish in the top four as intense as it has ever been. It will also be a major source of frustration to Arsenal supporters that it is far from the first time they have expected a player to miss a short length of time, only for setbacks to rule them out for an extended period. Here are some other examples: Jack Wilshere There are numerous examples of when Wilshere's notorious injury problems have kept him sidelined for longer than originally anticipated. Last season, he sustained a hairline fracture the day before the Community Shield and Wenger said he expected Wilshere to be out for 6-8 weeks. Jack Wilshere has had rotten luck with injuries and a number of setbacks when trying to return Last season, he played three times in the Premier League but made England's Euro 2016 squad The midfielder returned against Sunderland on April 24 and played in three Premier League games in that campaign. It was still enough time to convince England boss Roy Hodgson to take him to Euro 2016, however. Anticipated return: October 2015 Date of return: April 24, 2016 Aaron Ramsey Ramsey has endured his share of injuries during his time as an Arsenal player. The latest has occurred this season, when he was forced off with a muscular problem in Arsenal's first match of the season - a 4-3 defeat by Liverpool. Aaron Ramsey sustained a muscular injury on the first day of this season against Liverpool He eventually returned in October, but is now sidelined with a calf complaint Wenger believed the Wales international was going to be out for a maximum three weeks but Ramsey did not play again for Arsenal until October 29, again away to Sunderland. Ramsey is currently sidelined with a calf injury and no time has been given for when to expect his return. Anticipated return: Early-mid September Date of return: October 29 Danny Welbeck Welbeck has gone through significant injury problems since joining Arsenal from Manchester United. The first occurred in the 2014-15 season, where an inflamed knee was originally which flared up against Chelsea was expected to keep him out for days, according to Wenger. Danny Welbeck has had two major injuries since joining Arsenal from Manchester United Welbeck was expected to be out for 'days' in 2014-15 but missed 10 months with a knee injury Welbeck had a second knee injury last year and only returned to action in January But days turned into a month. He missed the FA Cup final and pre-season and the months began stacking up. He didn't even return that year - his next Arsenal appearance came on February 14 in a 2-1 win over Leicester, where he scored. Welbeck made a total of 15 appearances before sustaining another serious knee injury and only returned in January this year. Anticipated return: Days Date of return: February 14, 2016 Share or comment on this article Most watched Sport videos
